PDF_TO_IMG.py Documentation¶

This file uses OCR’s namely: Pytesseract and EasyOCR to extract the text from the pdf. OCR’s cannot extract text directly from PDF’s, so it is important for it to be converted to an image format before passing it through the OCR.

pdf_to_img.easyOCR(image)¶

Extracts text data from the image using EasyOCR

Parameters

image (png image) – Saved image, defaults to none

Returns

string: extracted text from the image

Return type

txt file

pdf_to_img.extractor_easyOCR(pather)¶

Converts pdf to image and then saves the image using EASYOCR

Parameters

pather (path) – Absolute path of the pdf, defaults to none

Returns

image: save the converted pdf in image format

Return type

png image

pdf_to_img.extractor_pytess(pather)¶

Converts pdf to image and then saves the image using Pytesseract

Parameters

pather (path) – Absolute path of the pdf, defaults to none

Returns

image: save the converted pdf in image format

Return type

png image

pdf_to_img.pytess(image)¶

Extracts text data from the image using Pytesseract OCR

Parameters

image (png image) – Saved image, defaults to none

Returns

extractedInfo: extracted text from the image

Return type

txt file
